p: As is reflected in other chapters in this book, sub-Saharan Africa faces unique challenges. While the region has made overall progress in reducing mortality and the burden of disease, different countries show increased instances of death within particular age groups and sexes. For example, between 1992 and 2012, Mozambique saw mortality rates among women aged 15 to 60 rising from 378 per 1000 people to 475 per 1000 people (World Bank 2014).
